image.altText: A mean wearing a blue shirt speaks on a microphone, with a teal and blue campaign sign behind him.

props.synopsis: Phil Scott was a prominent anti-fracking activist prior to running for the NT seat of Solomon, with Coalition frontbencher Jacinta Nampijinpa Price accusing him of behaving "like a petulant child".

title.children: Climate 200-backed candidate 'unhinged', Jacinta Nampijinpa Price says

image.altText: An Aboriginal woman signs a document while sitting on a park bench next to a man.

props.synopsis: A litigation funder will pocket one-sixth of a $180 million settlement in a historic Northern Territory stolen wages class action while the Aboriginal workers themselves will get "at least $10,000" each.

title.children: Judge critical of law firm behind $180m stolen wages class action

image.altText: Wiradjuri woman Tara Croker who launched startup Yaala Sparkling smiles at the camera while sitting indoors

props.synopsis: The Indigenous business sector is experiencing significant growth but challenges remain around access to capital, a lack of culturally safe support and entrenched racism.

title.children: Why a new wave of Indigenous businesses are failing to meet full potential

image.altText: A man sitting in a church with his hands together and head resting on them.

props.synopsis: Australian Catholics have paid tribute to Pope Francis at mass on Tuesday morning around the country. Australia's political and religious leaders are also paying their respects.

title.children: 'He's just been one of us': Australians grieve Pope Francis

image.altText: A woman with her eyes closed and head bowed.

props.synopsis: Crowds have converged on St Peter's Square in the hours since Pope Francis's death, the Vatican has announced his body could be lying in state as early as Wednesday, and US President Donald Trump has said he plans to attend the pontiff's funeral.

title.children: Trump says he will attend pope's funeral as large crowds flock to Vatican

image.altText: A man with white religious clothes sits smiling with colourful feathers on his head

props.synopsis: Catholics across the world are pausing to remember the life of Pope Francis. And the pontiff's death is being keenly felt in the Asia-Pacific region, where he leaves a significant legacy.

title.children: In Timor-Leste, almost everyone is Catholic. Today they mourn their 'king'

image.altText: A bundle of leaflets held together by yellow tape. The title says Allegra Spender Exposed

props.synopsis: Unauthorised pamphlets attacking independent MP Allegra Spender have been circulating in her electorate, calling her "weak" on antisemitism.

title.children: Who is behind 47,000 anonymous pamphlets attacking Allegra Spender?

image.altText: A chef.

props.synopsis: In Japan, it's called "shokunin", and it might be the reason why Tokyo is now the world's culinary capital.

title.children: For over 80 years, this Tokyo chef has been perfecting just one recipe

image.altText: NSW Police at Bankstown address where woman kidnapping took place

props.synopsis: The woman's male partner's alleged involvement with organised crime is being investigated, said police, with two children known to the woman remaining in hospital under police guard.

title.children: Partner of woman found dead in burnt-out car had 'conflict' with crime group, police say

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: The ASX has clawed back early losses after the US Fed chair's future was questioned and Wall Street crumbled. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX in the red but resists worst of Wall Street sell-off

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Morgan Stanley cuts ASX 200 target 8,000 points
ASX shrugs off Wall Street dive

image.altText: Pete Hegseth scratches the right of his forehead near his hairline with his left thumb as he sits at a table near a man.

props.synopsis: After another Signal controversy, there is mounting pressure on US Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth and reports of "dysfunction" and "mass chaos" inside the Pentagon.

title.children: 'Chaos' and 'dysfunction' reign inside Pete Hegseth's Pentagon

image.altText: composite Dutton Poilievre

props.synopsis: Recent polls have shown the opposition leaders in Australia and Canada moving from a strong position to become election underdogs in recent months. There's one major contributing factor.

title.children: Trump's shadow looms large over Australian and Canadian elections

image.altText: Kylie Truswell-Mobbs and David Mobbs smile while sitting next to each other with their heads together at a restaurant.

props.synopsis: Prosecutors told the court Brisbane woman Kylie Truswell-Mobbs injected her husband, who was in the final stages of Motor Neurone Disease, with pain medication for "the sole purpose of killing him".

title.children: Woman charged with killing terminally ill husband denied bail

image.altText: Starters' blocks on a rain-soaked grass track at the Stawell Gift.

props.synopsis: Victorian athletics officials say they may have to review the benchmark time used for handicapping the Stawell Gift and other races, after the failure of Lachlan Kennedy and Gout Gout to reach the final.

title.children: Stawell Gift winner says 11m handicap 'totally fair' despite criticism

image.altText: Police officers look inspect crashed red car on a highway.

props.synopsis: A 41-year-old Tewantin man, allegedly behind yesterday's fatal crash and a string of carjackings, has been charged with 15 offences and is expected to appear in court today.

title.children: Alleged carjacker charged over fatal Sunshine Coast crash, shooting

image.altText: Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory

props.synopsis: The thief stole a bike, a laptop, a saxophone and a guitar. But it all came tumbling down when the owner of a stolen iPad used the Find My iPad function.

title.children: Thief comes unstuck because of Find My iPad app

image.altText: An unidentified woman sitting on the floor with a calculator and bills around her

props.synopsis: If you’ve got an unexpected bill to pay or large expense and you don’t have the money to cover it, here’s what you can do.

title.children: If you need money fast, what are your options?

image.altText: Cameron McEvoy smiles

props.synopsis: Cam McEvoy has only properly swam a full 50 metres three times since winning Olympic gold in Paris. In Brisbane, he claimed another national title, further vindicating his innovative approach.

title.children: Minimal swimming, maximum medals as McEvoy's innovative approach pays off

image.altText: Noah Balta, wearing a black gurnsey with yellow sash, celebrates next to the goal post

props.synopsis: Richmond footballer Noah Balta has been ordered to adhere to a curfew as part of his sentence for assaulting a man in a Mulwala car park last year.

title.children: Court curfew order rules Balta out of Anzac eve AFL clash

image.altText: Meteor thumb

props.synopsis: A bright green ball of fire that caused a sonic boom and lit up the night sky from southern Queensland to New South Wales overnight was most likely a meteor, says an astrophysicist.

title.children: Fireball that lit up night sky likely a meteor, says astrophysicist

image.altText: A close up shot of Donald Trump looking at Xi Jinping.

props.synopsis: A US-China trade war is a battle neither side can win. It's more a question as to the amount of pain either country can endure and which will emerge with the least damage.

title.children: Has Trump bitten off more than he can chew in a US-China trade war?

image.altText: protesters stand outside Harvard building, one is holding a sign that says 'resist'

props.synopsis: The lawsuit filed in the federal court accuses the US government of attempting to "gain control of academic decision-making at Harvard".

title.children: Harvard files federal lawsuit against Trump administration

image.altText: A graphic showing Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton imposed over images of a wheelchair, NDIS logo, money and housing

props.synopsis: On the eve of a new parliament, these are three areas disability advocates want addressed, write Evan Young and Nas Campanella.

title.children: Three big disability issues the next government needs to address

image.altText: A green fogo bin mascot next to a recycling bin mascot and a landfill bin mascot outside  near trees

props.synopsis: Organic waste in several WA shires is going straight to landfill despite the tip tasked with processing it receiving significant funding to deal with FOGO.

title.children: Ratepayers 'grumpy' and 'disgusted' as FOGO efforts go to waste

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits at her home computer.

props.synopsis: "Return to office" demands appear to have peaked, with research noting a fall in mandates for a certain amount of in-person days. Five years from the start of the COVID pandemic, remote and hybrid models of working are now normalised.

title.children: Working from home not going anywhere as in-office mandates fall

image.altText: A man with pointy hair and maroon t-shirt smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: A man accused of the shooting murder of South Australian police officer Jason Doig has been found mentally incompetent by the state's Supreme Court.

title.children: Man charged over SA police officer's death found mentally incompetent

image.altText: Gloved hands holding COVID-19 vaccine, needle in glass container.

props.synopsis: Three local councils in South Australia have been passing motions questioning vaccines, but health experts say they are based on misinformation and heighten community risk.

title.children: Councils under fire for promoting vaccine scepticism

image.altText: A shot of Queensland Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Queensland taxpayers have footed a $162,500 recruitment bill for the government to hire four top bureaucrats.

title.children: Queensland government spends $162k recruiting four bureaucrats

image.altText: GettyImages-2210645632

props.synopsis: Geelong hangs on for a thrilling seven-point win against Hawthorn, with focus now shifting to the match review panel after Conor Nash knocked out Cats forward Gryan Miers.

title.children: AFL legend says there must be a send-off rule after Hawk's ugly high shot

image.altText: a person hold a bible from Gallipoli which is going on display at the Anzac Memorial in Sydney

props.synopsis: A young soldier was carrying a Bible when he was hit by shrapnel at Gallipoli — it's among the items on show in Sydney to mark 110 years since the ill-fated landing.

title.children: Gallipoli exhibition shines light on 'extraordinary generation of Australians'

image.altText: Women in cricket gear train at Manuka oval

props.synopsis: After years of silence, the International Cricket Council has announced a task force and monetary fund to help support the exiled Afghan women's team, with hopes the money will match the sum given to the men's team.

title.children: 'Devil's in the detail' of ICC plan for exiled Afghan women cricketers

image.altText: Hannah Green hits a tee shot

props.synopsis: In-form world number five Hannah Green will lead a seven-strong Australian challenge at women's golf's first major of the year, the Chevron Championship in Texas.

title.children: Hannah Green hopes lofty ranking can translate to major success

image.altText: Close up of Jenny Kee with red-rimmed glasses and black print outfit, smiling widely.

props.synopsis: At 78, Jenny Kee feels so passionately about her fashion creations that she refers to them as her "children". And while she says her career is slowing down, the evidence for that is hard to find.

title.children: Influential Australian fashion designer Jenny Kee on 'letting go'
